poem:
**The Windfall**

A windfall, 
sudden and vast—
the apple, 
once disputed, 
now ripe 
for bridges 
and roads.

In the green, 
old isle,
wealth unspilled, 
unused for 
ballot bribes. 

Families will cross 
over waters 
on new spans, 
plains paved 
not by wishes 
but through 
unexpected harvest.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Irish finance minister calls €14bn tax windfall from Apple ‘transformational’ The Irish finance minister has hailed the €14bn tax windfall from Apple as “transformational” just weeks after the government lost a case in the European court of justice arguing the tech company should keep its money. Unveiling the country’s budget on Tuesday, Jack Chambers said the money would be used on infrastructure and not splurged on giveaways before the general election, which is expected in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
